data.title: The Lincoln Lawyer season 3: Everything you need to know
data.meta_description: Is Lincoln Lawyer coming back in 2024? We've got all the latest release and cast news for Lincoln Lawyer's season 3...
data.text:
The Lincoln Lawyer is officially on its way to Netflix, having already been renewed. We also now know that production for season three is under way (via Deadline), bringing it just that little bit closer.

That being said, it's been suggested that we won't get season three of The Lincoln Lawyer this year – with a 2025 release date seeming more likely. But more on that in a moment.

The second season of the hit legal drama saw the episodes split into a two-part release, with a major cliffhanger to keep fans ticking over during the lull, as Mickey faced his toughest case yet.

But what does The Lincoln Lawyer have in store for us in season three? We're here to break down everything you need to know about the much-loved adaptation on Netflix.

Is The Lincoln Lawyer season 3 coming back in 2024?

As mentioned above, The Lincoln Lawyer has officially been renewed, and we know we'll be getting 10 new episodes when the new season eventually arrives.

According to Deadline, The Lincoln Lawyer season three has been name-checked along with a list of other big-hitting Netflix shows that won't be releasing in 2024, instead skipping to a likely 2025 return date.

Others not expected to stream this year include Stranger Things season 5, the Jenna Ortega-fronted series Wednesday season 2 and Ginny and Georgia season 3.

Fans of Netflix's popular attorney showed up in droves to watch the previous season. The second half of The Lincoln Lawyer season two knocked The Witcher season three off the top spot on the Netflix chart and even squeezed out the highly-anticipated second season of Heartstopper, which came in second.

The second part Lincoln Lawyer's season two added another 6.7 million views, jumping up the overall figure to 23.3 million in total.

Of the show's success, showrunners Ted Humphrey and Dailyn Rodriguez said: "The audience response to the show has been so gratifying and wonderful, and we are thrilled to have the opportunity to dive back into Michael Connelly's universe and bring Mickey Haller and his world to the screen again."

Who will be part of The Lincoln Lawyer season 3's cast?

When The Lincoln Lawyer returns, Manuel Garcia-Rulfo will be back as attorney extraordinaire Mickey Haller and be joined by close aide and Lincoln expert Izzy Letts, played by Jazz Raycole.

Other cast members confirmed to be returning for season three are:

• Becki Newton as Lorna Crane

• Elliott Gould as David 'Legal' Siegel

• Krista Warner as Hayley Haller

• Fiona Rene as Gloria Dayton

• Devon Graye as Julian La Cosse

• Angus Sampson as Cisco Wojciechowski

• Yaya DaCosta as Andrea Freeman

There were inklings that season two would be the last we saw of Neve Campbell – who plays Mickey's first wife Maggie McPherson – as her role was drastically reduced.

However, some new first-look photos for the upcoming third season have confirmed her return.

We're also expecting some new faces in The Lincoln Lawyer season three, with cast announcements including:

• Merrin Dungey (Big Little Lies), who will play Judge Regina Turner. Regina is a former public defender described as someone who's "younger and more progressive than most judges in the district".

• Newcomer Allyn Moriyon will mark his TV debut as fitness enthusiast Eddie Rojas, who used to babysit Mickey's daughter Hayley. When Eddie requires a good lawyer, Mickey is on hand to support and also "offers him the opportunity of a lifetime".

• John Pirruccello (Barry) is taking on the role of prosecutor William Forsythe, who Mickey faces in court. However, once the trial begins, it becomes clear that "nothing is as it seems".

• Philip Anthony-Rodriguez (The Morning Show) has been cast as Chief Deputy District Attorney Adam Suarez, the superior of prosecutor Andrea Freeman.

What will happen in The Lincoln Lawyer season 3?

Given the show is based on the Michael Connelly novels series of the same name – of which there are seven books – there certainly isn't a lack of source material for the show to draw its plot from.

The first season of the show drew on the second Connelly novel, The Reversal, given that the first novel had been adapted into a Matthew McConaughey film – so a third season will derive from the fourth novel.

The Gods of Guilt sees Mickey contacted by a client of yore who's in desperate need of his services. Mickey takes on the case of Andre La Cosse, despite the fact that he's accused of murdering a sex worker the attorney had previously tried to help.

Sharing the unique way they've decided to adapt the book, co-showrunners and executive producers Ted Humphrey and Dailyn Rodriguez told Deadline: "While season three of The Lincoln Lawyer is based on Michael Connelly's novel The Gods of Guilt, we decided that a fun (and poignant) way to come into the season would be via a flashback sequence that gave us some insight into how Mickey Haller became Mickey Haller – not just the brilliant criminal defence lawyer but the husband, the father, and the man that he would come to be.

"There is no comparable flashback in the book, so we devised something that would also serve as a fitting introduction to the story of the season, both on a plot level but also emotionally."

Is there a trailer for The Lincoln Lawyer season 3?

Alas, there isn't any new footage from The Lincoln Lawyer season three yet.

But when word comes down from Netflix on high, we'll put it into discovery for you.
